findings.title: Risk of DoS attacks due to rate limits
findings.description: Malicious users could launch denial-of-service (DoS) attacks due to rate limits imposed on MONO deposit and withdrawal operations.

findings.title: Risk of accounting errors due to missing check in the invest function
findings.description: Because of a missing check in the `invest` function, investing multiple tokens with different decimals in the same strategy will result in incorrect profit-and-loss (PnL) reporting, which could result in the loss of user or protocol funds.

findings.title: Missing functionality in the _rescueTokens function
findings.description: The _rescueTokens function incorrectly transfers zero tokens when it reaches a zero-value entry in the _amounts array instead of transferring the entire token balance.

findings.title: Solidity compiler optimizations can be problematic
findings.description: Security issues due to optimization bugs have occurred in the past and may still exist or be introduced in the future, potentially causing security vulnerabilities in smart contracts.

findings.title: Lack of contract existence check on call
findings.description: The multiexcall function does not include contract existence checks when making batched calls to various target addresses, which can lead to unexpected behavior if the target address is incorrect or a contract that is subsequently destroyed.

findings.title: Arbitrage opportunity in the PSM contract
findings.description: An arbitrage opportunity exists in the PSM contract where a user can deposit USDC tokens and receive MONO tokens worth more than the deposited amount, allowing for risk-free profit.

findings.title: Problematic use of safeApprove
findings.description: The `safeApprove` function is used incorrectly and is officially deprecated. It should only be called when setting an initial allowance or when resetting it to zero, otherwise subsequent redemption operations will revert.

findings.title: Lack of upper bound for fees and system parameters
findings.description: Multiple contracts including Rewarder, Treasury, PSM, and PolyMinter have unbounded system parameters and lack upper limits for minting and redeeming fees.

findings.title: Incorrect PnL Reporting Due to Multiple Tokens with Different Decimals
findings.description: Investing multiple tokens with different decimals in the same strategy will result in incorrect profit-and-loss (PnL) reporting, which could result in the loss of user or protocol funds.
